values: *runs through the open plains, Kiri trailing at his heels* It's just so refreshing to be able to just run without a care in the world. *gallops away into the sunset, amiring the dying glow*

For awhile now I have been roaming in the forests. My sister and uncle seem to have disappeared. 

*runs back off with Kiri*

"Forever" perhaps... In reality, not all that long. But long enough to make it seem like it was longer. We - my su'fali, my rujholla and I - have born witness to some of the more bizarre things this world has to offer. But some things are easier to understand than others. Weddings are easy to understand. So are births and deaths - those are a frequent thing in my home. Even the notion of humans taking animal shape is nothing worth getting concerned about. But people becoming animals - unwillingly - that is another matter. I'd help them, but I have been told by my lir Kiri that I have a bigger matter to think about here. What it is, she will not tell me; only that I need to keep my focus during the next few days or weeks. This isn't that unusual - lir keeping secrets, but gods, it can be so maddening at times... *sigh* I suppose if I'm to do what Kiri asks, I need to go outside and do a few patrols around the grounds. Preferably without getting lost in these lands... *blurs to fox-shape and runs off, Kiri following behind*

It seems that Glorfindel-friend has gotten himself into more trouble. Ian suggests that we save up our reserves and try to use the earth magic on him. I'm just hoping that the magic doesn't have an effect on him. From what I've conjected, he can shift between stallion, half-elf, fox, and elf. With being able to take on that many forms, the magic may cause difficults... *sighs heavily* I suppose since I won't be able to use my lir form for a few days before and after, I'd better take a romp now...Kiri? *he takes off into the nearby forest with the little vixen trailing close by*

So it seems that I'm being dragged off by Glorfindel and his lir. Each of them seem eager to see his lover again. I've been told that shi's nice, and would make a good friend for Keely. I think she could use some socialization with others besides family. Perhaps this will be a good thing...

Corin walks into his sleep chambers followed by his deep red lir, Kiri. He settles down for a long rest, with the little vixen cuddling up next to him. The darkness comes, and they both slip into that alternate world where reality is suspended. Corin dreams. He dreams of a place filled with forests, elves, humans, halflings, dwarves, and others. They are strange to him. He tries calling out to Kiri for advice, but she can't be reached while he's sleeping. The link is denied to him. He runs. Running from anything. But he cannot escape. He is trapped within the dream. A large shape comes towards him, black, and the face is masked. The creatures goes to show his head, and suddenly... He's awake. Corin thrashes around, looking for his lir, and sees her laying nearby. Only then does he realize that he's not in his bed, but under a large tree instead. Again, he sees a figure moving towards him, but it's different. Two white foxes come into focus. Corin tenses, not knowing what to expect of them since they are from a different place than he's used to. 'Lir, shansu, the one is a lir like myself, and the other is a what is described as a Cheysuli-elf. Zy says that Glorfindel will not harm you in anyway. Only that they are waiting for his companion to successfully rescue his harana, Keely.' Kiri says softly. 'Keely?! Here? If she's in trouble, I must help her! She's my twin rujholla.' 'Zy says that he and Glorfie made it able for Ian and Tasha to enter and try to help her. We should know soon to what happens.' He nods, and turns to the two foxes. Glorfindel blurs back to his human form and stands before Corin. Each of them looks into the other's eyes, and have only to see that each is true to the other. That they will never turn on one another, almost like a tu'alla dei or leige man to the other. Although, not quite the same thing. They sit without words, awaiting the news....
